results.title: Differential effects of metformin on immune-mediated and androgen-mediated non-cancer skin diseases in diabetes patients: a retrospective cohort study.
results.text_hl: Differential effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on immune-mediated and androgen-mediated @<m>DISEASE_Nonsyndromic_Holoprosencephaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580335 @@@non-@@@@DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ @DISEASE_Skin_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D012871 @@@skin diseases@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@: a retrospective cohort study.

citations.NLM: Tseng CH. Differential effects of metformin on immune-mediated and androgen-mediated non-cancer skin diseases in diabetes patients: a retrospective cohort study. Dermatology. 2023 Mar 15;():. PMID: 36921584
citations.BibTeX: @article{36921584, title={Differential effects of metformin on immune-mediated and androgen-mediated non-cancer skin diseases in diabetes patients: a retrospective cohort study.}, author={Tseng CH}, journal={Dermatology}}

results.title: [Treatment experience with metformin in polycystic ovary syndrome].
results.text_hl: Based on the favourable international experience with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in the most common female @DISEASE_Endocrine_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D004700 @@@endocrine disease@@@, the @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@, which has @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin resistance@@@ in the background, the author's treatment advice has been this in such cases since early 2002: for sexually active @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ who do not want to become pregnant for the time being, anti-androgenic contraceptive pill; for those who do not want to take contraceptives, contraceptives are contraindicated, or who do want to conceive, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@. 44/71 @<m>DISEASE_Nonsyndromic_Holoprosencephaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580335 @@@non@@@-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ opted for @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Petrányi G. [Treatment experience with metformin in polycystic ovary syndrome]. Orv Hetil. 2005 May 22;146(21):1151-5. PMID: 15991679
citations.BibTeX: @article{15991679, title={[Treatment experience with metformin in polycystic ovary syndrome].}, author={Petrányi G}, journal={Orv Hetil}, volume={146}, number={21}, pages={1151-5}}

results.title: Metformin Alters Gut Microbiota of Healthy Mice: Implication for Its Potential Role in Gut Microbiota Homeostasis
results.text_hl: This result underscores the potential effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on gut microbiome homeostasis, which may contribute to the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Nonsyndromic_Holoprosencephaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580335 @@@non-@@@@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic diseases@@@.

citations.NLM: Ma W, Chen J, Meng Y, Yang J, Cui Q, Zhou Y. Metformin Alters Gut Microbiota of Healthy Mice: Implication for Its Potential Role in Gut Microbiota Homeostasis Front Microbiol. 2018;9():1336. PMID: 29988362
citations.BibTeX: @article{29988362, title={Metformin Alters Gut Microbiota of Healthy Mice: Implication for Its Potential Role in Gut Microbiota Homeostasis}, author={Ma W and Chen J and Meng Y and Yang J and Cui Q and Zhou Y}, journal={Front Microbiol}, volume={9}, pages={1336}}

results.title: Pantoprazole may improve beta cell function and diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Seventy-nine male @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (38 @<m>DISEASE_Nonsyndromic_Holoprosencephaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C580335 @@@non-@@@@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ and 41 @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type-2 diabetic@@@ receiving only @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy) were followed for 12 weeks after @CHEMICAL_Pantoprazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077402 @@@pantoprazole@@@ 40 mg/day was given.

citations.NLM: Inci F, Atmaca M, Ozturk M, Yildiz S, Koceroglu R, Sekeroglu R, Ipekci SH, Kebapcilar L. Pantoprazole may improve beta cell function and diabetes mellitus. J Endocrinol Invest. 2014 May;37(5):449-54. PMID: 24682913
citations.BibTeX: @article{24682913, title={Pantoprazole may improve beta cell function and diabetes mellitus.}, author={Inci F and Atmaca M and Ozturk M and Yildiz S and Koceroglu R and Sekeroglu R and Ipekci SH and Kebapcilar L}, journal={J Endocrinol Invest}, volume={37}, number={5}, pages={449-54}}
